alert.note: Alert for Kern; Kings (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 3:35PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Kern and Kings. * WHEN...Until 645 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 334 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bakersfield, Wasco, Avenal, Taft, Maricopa, McKittrick, Derby Acres, Tupman, Valley Acres, Ford City, Dustin Acres, Taft Heights, South Taft, Frazier Park, Belridge, Lost Hills, Buttonwillow, Twisselman, Harris Ranch and Blackwells Corner. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
